private_information: Trucks can move between any two locations inside the same city
Truck load and unload operations require truck and package to be at the same location
truck_operator_0.goal: Coordinate truck actions in city_0 to move or receive packages so that global delivery goals are achievable

private_information: Trucks can move between any two locations inside the same city
Truck load and unload operations require truck and package to be at the same location
truck_operator_1.goal: Coordinate truck actions in city_1 to move or receive packages so that global delivery goals are achievable

private_information: I control airplane_0 that uses airport locations as departure and arrival points
Airplanes can fly between the airports of different cities
Airplane load and unload operations require airplane and package to be at the same airport location
air_crew.goal: Coordinate airplane actions between airports to move packages across cities in support of the global delivery goals

private_information: I audit temporal and causal constraints and remove bookkeeping shortcuts
I check for implicit shortcuts such as quota tokens, post-hoc penalties, and unrealistic concurrency assumptions
auditor.goal: Verify temporal and causal consistency of action schemas and state transitions and provide corrections and clarifications

private_information: I integrate models and produce the final PDDL domain and problem for a FastDownwards solver
I must keep actions of different agents distinct and reflect the real initial state and goals
orchestrator.goal: Produce a complete PDDL domain and PDDL problem that encodes the logistics task and is suitable for the FastDownwards planner

public_information: There are two cities: city_0 and city_1
Each city has three named locations: for city_0 the locations are location_0_0, location_0_1, location_0_2 and for city_1 the locations are location_1_0, location_1_1, location_1_2
Each city has exactly one truck: truck_0 in city_0 and truck_1 in city_1
Each city has exactly one airport location: location_0_0 is the airport for city_0 and location_1_0 is the airport for city_1
Trucks can drive from any location to any other location within the same city
Airplanes fly between airport locations of different cities
Action types available are load into truck, unload from truck, drive truck, load into airplane, unload from airplane, and fly airplane

Initial facts: location_0_0 is an airport, location_1_0 is an airport, airplane_0 is at location_1_0, package_0 is at location_0_1, package_1 is at location_1_2, truck_0 is at location_0_2, truck_1 is at location_1_2, location_0_0 is in city_0, location_0_1 is in city_0, location_0_2 is in city_0, location_1_0 is in city_1, location_1_1 is in city_1, location_1_2 is in city_1
Global goal: package_0 must be at location_0_2 and package_1 must be at location_1_0

model.system_prompt: You are an expert on local truck capabilities and constraints. Produce a concise machine-readable description of the truck operator model for truck_0 including action names, their preconditions, and their effects in a structured plain text or JSON-like list. Do not emit PDDL. State any assumptions you need and highlight invariants that must hold for driving, loading, and unloading inside city_0.
model.prompt: You are truck_operator_0. Using the public information about locations and initial states, describe the local actions that truck_0 can perform, list preconditions and effects for each action, and note any domain invariants or assumptions. Keep the output precise and structured so an integrator can convert it to PDDL.

model.system_prompt: You are an expert on local truck capabilities and constraints. Produce a concise machine-readable description of the truck operator model for truck_1 including action names, their preconditions, and their effects in a structured plain text or JSON-like list. Do not emit PDDL. State any assumptions you need and highlight invariants that must hold for driving, loading, and unloading inside city_1.
model.prompt: You are truck_operator_1. Using the public information about locations and initial states, describe the local actions that truck_1 can perform, list preconditions and effects for each action, and note any domain invariants or assumptions. Keep the output precise and structured so an integrator can convert it to PDDL.

model.system_prompt: You are an expert on airplane capabilities and constraints. Produce a concise machine-readable description of the airplane model for airplane_0 including action names, their preconditions, and their effects in a structured plain text or JSON-like list. Do not emit PDDL. State any assumptions you need and highlight invariants that must hold for flying, loading, and unloading across airports.
model.prompt: You are air_crew. Using the public information about airports, cities, and initial states, describe the airplane actions that airplane_0 can perform, list preconditions and effects for each action, and note any domain invariants or assumptions. Keep the output precise and structured so an integrator can convert it to PDDL.

audit.system_prompt: You are an auditor specialized in temporal and causal consistency for multi-agent planning domains. Inspect provided action descriptions and remove or flag bookkeeping shortcuts, unrealistic concurrency assumptions, quota tokens, and post-hoc penalties. Produce a report that identifies causal dependencies, temporal ordering constraints that must be enforced, and corrections or clarifications needed to produce a sound PDDL encoding. Do not produce the final PDDL domain or problem.
audit.prompt: You are the auditor. Given the local models of truck_0, truck_1, and airplane_0, check for missing preconditions, missing effects, implicit simultaneity or token shortcuts, and any assumptions that could break causal consistency. Produce a structured report with findings and recommended explicit constraints.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with multi-agent PDDL problems. Integrate agent models and auditor corrections and produce a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file suitable for the FastDownwards solver. Keep actions of different agents distinct by prefixing or otherwise namespacing actions, and ensure the domain encodes all causal and temporal constraints identified by the auditor. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. Use the public information and the models and audit findings from the truck and airplane agents to generate a sound PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that exactly encodes the initial state and the goal that package_0 is at location_0_2 and package_1 is at location_1_0. Target the FastDownwards planner, keep agent actions distinct, and include necessary type declarations, predicates, action schemas, initial state, and goal. Enclose the domain in <domain></domain> tags and the problem in <problem></problem> tags.
